title: PAINAD Scale (Dementia) Schema
description:
Create PAINAD Pain Assessment Scale Schema for Dementia Patients

Design and implement a structured data schema for the Pain Assessment in Advanced Dementia (PAINAD) scale, which evaluates pain through observable behavioral indicators in patients with severe dementia.

Requirements:
- Include all five PAINAD assessment categories with proper scoring:
  1. Breathing (independent of vocalization)
  2. Negative vocalization
  3. Facial expression
  4. Body language
  5. Consolability
- Define scoring scale for each category (0-2 points per category, 0-10 total)
- Specify behavioral descriptors for each score level (0, 1, 2) within each category
- Include metadata fields: patient identifier, assessor name/role, assessment timestamp, total score
- Add field for additional clinical notes or observations
- Ensure schema supports tracking multiple assessments over time for trend analysis
- Define validation rules to ensure scores fall within acceptable ranges
- Include interpretation guidelines (e.g., 0 = no pain, 1-3 = mild, 4-6 = moderate, 7-10 = severe)
- Consider compliance with healthcare data standards (FHIR, HL7) if applicable
- Document the schema structure with clear field definitions and data types
